intro: Euphrasia imbricata var. setulosa, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and meadows. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its medicinal properties. The hairy texture of its foliage is a distinguishing feature of this variety.
